results.title: Subway [Dubbed]
results.creator_credit: Les Films du Loup, TSF Production, Gaumont-British Instructional, TFI Films, Luc Besson and Francois Ruggieri
results.brief_description: This strange combination of action, comedy, violence and suspense tells the story of a cool rebel on the run, who uses the dark tunnels of the Paris subway as his hideout. There he meets a wide assortment of unusual characters. Stars Christopher Lambert and Isabelle Adjani. The soundtrack has been dubbed into English.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Les Films du Loup, TSF Production, Gaumont-British Instructional, TFI Films, Luc Besson and Francois Ruggieri

results.title: Subversive desires
results.creator_credit: London Electronic Arts, Akiko Hada, WKBC-TV, George E. Saxon, Julie Kuzminska and George Snow
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Video burn”.
A collection of contemporary video music clips which explore some of the avant-garde electronic music and performance coming from Great Britain. As the title for the collection suggests, this volume of “Video Burn” explores themes of sexuality and transgression. All the video artists involved have attempted to trace modern experimentation with sex, fashion and gender in forms which arise from 19th century popular theatre: the circus, gambling, and pantomime. In “The Jack Series”, George E. Saxon uses the myth of Jack the Ripper to examine the decadence of Victorian sexuality and how it still resonates today in sado-masochistic imagery; “Archaos”, by Julie Kuziminska, is a video celebration of the anarchic circus troupe of the same name; and “Assignation” is a video performance of an Edgar Allan Poe short story which brings the story’s sublimated sexuality to the fore.

results.title: Suburban streetscape: living Hawthorn 1906 & 1979
results.creator_credit: Deakin University, Michael Rogers and Weston Bate
results.brief_description: Compares 1906 footage of the main streets of the Melbourne suburb of Hawthorn with footage of the same streets in 1979. Contains b&w footage.

results.title: Suburban living: six solutions
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Ian MacNeill and Richard Gilbert
results.brief_description: A comparison of solutions to the problems of suburban living as found in some of the world’s largest cities - London, Marseille, Rotterdam, Stockholm and Toronto. This film shows housing to delight, amaze, and even provoke. Shown is Marseille’s famous community on stilts, with stores, homes, and playgrounds all within one vertical neighbourhood. Town planners and architects discuss trends and problems.

results.title: Substantial shadows
results.brief_description: An elegant, silent meditation on different light forms as they emerge from and transform different obscure, shadowy environments. A miner’s torch flickers across the walls of a cave, a candle flame flickers in a shadow dance, a bonfire blazes in the darkness, a trail of artificial lights illuminate a kitsch architectural structure. Creating a montage that takes its rhythms from the waxing and waning motions of the different light sources Austrian artist Lisl Ponger proposes a playful and poetic contemplation of light and shadow and their qualities when captured as cinematic images.

results.title: Subsistence agriculture: sago
results.brief_description: Sago is the staple food of people in the New Guinea Lowland, this film shows the sago palm, preparation and storage of sago flour and making of sago jelly. Illustrates the susbistence economy and food habits of people living in tropical rainforests.

results.title: subscape_PROOF
results.brief_description:
Traditionally, western cartography combines multiple data sets in a two dimensional representation. The datamapping (cross-referencing of datasets) tells a story - the land use and landforms of a place. Imaginative and politicised choice of datasets creates more esoteric ‘maps’.

sub_scapePROOF uses video/audio footage of televised political rhetoric and confessional TV shows. Onto these are mapped other sources of ‘data’ generated from philosophical and poetic texts.

sub_scapePROOF critiques the notion of evidential, superficial ‘truth’, in a post-faith age. By mapping data from post-colonial locations back onto the language of superpower politics, sub_scape generates a playful and ironic critique on the traditional politics and power dynamics of knowledge-through-mapping.
- Waterson and Richards.

results.title: Submarine control
results.creator_credit: Halas and Batchelor Cartoon Films, Allan Crick and Bob Privett
results.brief_description: An explanation of the basic principles of hydrostatics which govern the movements of submarines. The film includes simple demonstrations of neutral, positive and negative buoyancies and methods used to keep a submarine in trim.

results.title: Sub-Igloo [French version]
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, James de B. Domville, Colin Low and Joseph MacInnis
results.brief_description: Film report from a Canadian scientific expedition that put a plastic bubble on the floor of the Arctic Ocean to serve as workshop and rest station for scientists working below the Arctic ice. What it took, in both planning and on-the-spot improvisation, to chop through the heavy ice, and to lower and anchor the huge dome in place in the dark and cold of Resolute Bay, is fully illustrated by film and commentary. French language - no subtitles. (Award: Bordeaux.)
